intro: Escobariopsis sinistrohamata, commonly known as the left-sided horned lichen, is a species of lichen that belongs to the family Caloplacaceae. It is characterized by its unique thallus structure, which is typically crustose and forms a thin, tightly adherent layer on its substrate. The plant exhibits a distinctive morphology with prominent, asymmetrical lobes and a dark, often blackish or reddish coloration. It is usually found on rock surfaces in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in regions with low humidity and high sunlight exposure. Due to its specialized habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and cryptic species, often difficult to identify without expert knowledge.
